headline: Hasbro expects continued growth as CEO points to IP, hobby gaming
summary: Coming off the toymaker's fourth quarter earnings results, Hasbro (HAS) CEO Chris Cocks explains the continued growth that the company expects to see due to its IP (intellectual property), hobby gaming like Dungeons & Dragons and Magic: The Gathering, and toy partnerships with Disney (DIS). Also catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Chris Cocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Mattel Q4: More Pain Ahead, But It Is Getting Interesting
summary: Mattel, Inc. stock sank after weak Q4 and 2026 guidance. Get key takeaways on tariffs, Barbie's slowdown, and its $150M digital shift. Click for more on MAT earnings.

headline: Hasbro earnings: CEO talks results & what is driving toy demand
summary: Toymaker Hasbro (HAS) reported better-than-expected fourth quarter earnings results. headline: Ford, Lyft, Kraft Heinz, Hasbro, Mattel: Earnings Roundup
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rising in Wednesday's pre-market trading after the January jobs report saw the US economy grow by 130,000 non-farm payrolls last month, double the job growth expected by economists. Companies like Ford (F), Lyft (LYFT), Kraft Heinz (KHC), Hasbro (HAS), and Mattel (MAT) also reported their latest earnings results amid all this fresh economic news. Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman dives into the latest earnings results from top companies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Mattel: Citi and JPM cut rating as analysts flag uncertain outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Mattel faced sharp criticism from Citi and JPMorgan after both banks downgraded the toymaker following its latest earnings release, citing weakening visibility around its core brands and a challenging investment phase ahead.

raw.headline: Mattel: Citi and JPM cut rating as analysts flag uncertain outlook

headline: A tale of two toymakers: Mattel craters, while Hasbro's digital pivot delivers
summary: Mattel and Hasbro both delivered disappointing forecasts for 2026.  While both are grappling with soft demand for traditional toys, Hasbro's success in digital gaming has fundamentally altered its risk profile, turning a bleak forecast into ​a minor blip.  For Mattel, the same macroeconomic warning was enough to send its shares sharply lower.

headline: Mattel Stock Plunges 30% After Earnings. Rival Hasbro Soared In a Very Different Toy Story.
summary: Mattel  stock plunged more than 30% ahead of the open Wednesday after its earnings report disappointed Wall Street.  Weak holiday sales in the U.S. hit Mattel’s earnings as the company fell short of the strong growth it had anticipated in December.  For Mattel, though, the holiday period was a disappointment.

headline: HAS Q4 Deep Dive: Partnerships, Magic Momentum, and Cost Discipline Drive Results
summary: Toy and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 31.3% year on year to $1.45 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.51 per share was 59.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Wall Street inches higher in premarket trading ahead of the government's January jobs report
summary: U.S. markets were barely higher in cautious premarket trading Wednesday ahead of an update on U.S. employment that is expected to confirm a still-sluggish job market.  Shares of Mattel, the maker of Barbie, Hot Wheels and Fisher-Price toys, fell more than 26% after it closed out a rough year by missing Wall Street's sales and profit targets.  Mattel reported 2025 net income of $398 million, a decline of $144 million from the previous year.

Mattel reported 2025 net income of $398 million, a decline of $144 million from the previous year.

headline: Barbie Maker Mattel To Buy NetEase's Stake In Gaming Venture For $159 Million As MAT Stock Falls On Tepid Results
summary: Mattel buys NetEase's 50% stake in its joint venture Mattel163 for $159 million on Tuesday to beef up mobile-gaming efforts.
